invocations.description: Returns an iteration loop between screen tiles coordinates. Optionally you can set a order sorting function to sort tiles (ORDER_RADIAL, ORDER_RADIAL_INVERSE, ORDER_RANDOM, ORDER_EUCLIDEAN, ORDER_EUCLIDEAN_INVERSE, ORDER_REALDIST, ORDER_REALDIST_INVERSE or made sort function). Optionally you can set the range distance get coordinates. Optionally you can add a mod function to modify use the coordinates as parameter and return the value generated by the function.
invocations.ex:
for x, y, z in screentiles(ORDER_RADIAL_INVERSE, 5) do
	addwaypoint('stand', x, y, z)
end
invocations.exDescription: Adds a waypoint to all coordinates within range distance 5 of your character, in the inverse radial order, that means from outside to the middle.

invocations.description: Returns an iteration loop between screen tiles coordinates. Optionally you can set a order sorting function to sort tiles (ORDER_RADIAL, ORDER_RADIAL_INVERSE, ORDER_RANDOM, ORDER_EUCLIDEAN, ORDER_EUCLIDEAN_INVERSE, ORDER_REALDIST, ORDER_REALDIST_INVERSE or made sort function). Optionally you can set the range distance get coordinates. Optionally you can add a mod function to modify use the coordinates as parameter and return the value generated by the function.
invocations.ex:
for tile in screentiles(false, {-5, 5, -2, 2}, gettile) do
	print(tile)
end
invocations.exDescription: It'll print all the tile information inside the range -5x+5x-2y+2y in the default order
